unit_learning_outcomes.description: Appraise the function of evidence and research in health care.
Explain and reflect on how culture, beliefs, and inequality influence teams and our worldview.
Examine ethical principles and how they relate to clinical research and practice.
Explain the role of normative and critical thinking on professional practice in health care.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Topical readings required for tutorial preparation

assessments.description: A written report analysing an ethical scenario.
Short in-class quiz using MCQs and SAQs to assess lecture, tutorial and reading material conducted under exam conditions.

A three-part assessment that includes: 1. the production of a campaign video to train healthcare workers, medical researchers or BClinSci students on an area of socio-cultural awareness for practice; 2. an explainer about aim and audience for video, with reference list; and 3. a reflection for your portfolio.

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit focuses on the core knowledge and skills that underpin a career in health care as a researcher, manager, or practitioner. In this unit, you will explore professionalism in society, focusing on: ethics, psychology, and anthropology, and reflect on your understanding of professionalism in the health context. Learning activities will include interactive tutorials, online activities, and expert lectures. Through this unit you will continue your development as a reflective learner with a focus on the graduate capabilities of a scholar and an ethical and reflective professional.
